<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Whip](/Weapons.aspx?ID=48)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Disarm" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=175" />
<trait label="Finesse" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=179" />
<trait label="Nonlethal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=188" />
<trait label="Reach" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=192" />
<trait label="Trip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=196" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 281 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Favored Weapon** [Aakriti](/Deities.aspx?ID=261), [Abraxas](/Deities.aspx?ID=71), [Ahriman](/Deities.aspx?ID=220), [Calistria](/Deities.aspx?ID=3), [Dahak](/Deities.aspx?ID=150), [Gendowyn](/Deities.aspx?ID=152), [Gogunta](/Deities.aspx?ID=25), [Lissala](/Deities.aspx?ID=156), [Matravash](/Deities.aspx?ID=193), [Moloch](/Deities.aspx?ID=70), [Ragadahn](/Deities.aspx?ID=99), [Ranginori](/Deities.aspx?ID=106), [Selket](/Deities.aspx?ID=59)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 1 sp

**Damage** 1d4 S

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Martial

**Group** [Flail](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=7)
</row>

</column>

---

This long strand of thick leather, often braided, delivers a painful but nonlethal slash at a distance, usually accompanied by a distinctive cracking sound.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-7" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Weapons</title>
[Alghollthu Lash](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1881), [Lady's Spiral](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1539), [Slime Whip](/Equipment.aspx?ID=792), [Vine Whip](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1889), [Whip of Compliance](/Equipment.aspx?ID=593)
name: Whip

text: <title level="1" right="Weapon 0" pfs="Standard" > Whip Source Core Rulebook pg. 281 4.0 Favored Weapon Aakriti, Abraxas, Ahriman, Calistria, Dahak, Gendowyn, Gogunta, Lissala, Matravash, Moloch, Ragadahn, Ranginori, Selket Price 1 sp Damage 1d4 S Bulk 1 Hands 1 Category Martial Group Flail --- This long strand of thick leather, often braided, delivers a painful but nonlethal slash at a distance, usually accompanied by a distinctive cracking sound. Critical Specialization Effects Source Core Rulebook pg. 283 4.0 Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon. Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects.
